drug.name: Sodium tripolyphosphate
drug.description: Sodium tripolyphosphate is an inorganic compound with formula Na5P3O10 and the sodium salt of the polyphosphate penta-anion. It is used as a component of a wide range domestic and industrial products, particularly detergents.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of inorganic compounds known as alkali metal phosphates. These are inorganic compounds in which the largest oxoanion is phosphate, and in which the heaviest atom not in an oxoanion is an alkali metal.

drug-interaction.name: Calcium acetate
drug-interaction.description: Calcium acetate can cause a decrease in the absorption of Sodium tripolyphosphate resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy.
